title: Prototyping an instructible interface: Moctec
proctitle: CHI '92: Proceedings of the SIGCHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
abstract: Moctec is a set of interactive mockups of an interface for programming search and replace tasks by example. The user guides inference by pointing at relevant features of data.

references.text: Cendrowska, J. PRISM: analgorithm for inducing modular rules. IJMMS 27,4, pp. 349-370. 1988.
Cypher, A. EAGER: programmingrepetitive tasks by example. Proc. CHI '91, pp. 33-40. May 1991.
Halbert, D.C," Programming by example. Research rePort OSD-T8402. Xerox PARC. Palo Alto. 1984.
Lieberman, H. Mondfian: a teachable graphical editor. Technical report, MIT Media Lab. 1991.
Maulsby, D.L., I.H. Witten, K.A. Kittlitz, V.G. Franceschin. Inferring graphical procedures: the compleat Metamouse. Human Computer Interaction 7,1. 1992.
Myers, B.A. Creating User Interfaces by Demonstration. Academic Press. San Diego. 1988.
Steams, (3. R. Agents and the HP NewWave applicaion interface. Hewlett-Packard Journal, August 1989, pp. 32-37.
